headline.main: HEALTH: Neurology; Hopeful Findings for Premenstrual Syndrome

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A new study suggests that depression and some other symptoms of premenstrual syndrome can be significantly reduced with an obesity drug that affects a major transmitter chemical in the brain.
docs.snippet: LEAD: A new study suggests that depression and some other symptoms of premenstrual syndrome can be significantly reduced with an obesity drug that affects a major transmitter chemical in the brain.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: CLOTHING for fat children, in the not too distant past, was sold in the ''chubby'' department. Stores are no longer so insensitive that they call attention to obese children in this way. But the children's peers have no such qualms: fat children are still subject to cruel taunts.
